description:
Stachybotrys chartarum IBT 40293 is a species of filamentous fungus that belongs to the genus Stachybotrys. It is a saprophytic fungus, meaning it primarily feeds on decaying organic matter.

Stachybotrys chartarum IBT 40293 is known to produce a range of secondary metabolites, including mycotoxins, which can have potential adverse effects on human and animal health. The strain IBT 40293 has been used in various research studies to investigate the production and characteristics of these mycotoxins.

The fungus typically grows as a dark green or black mold on damp, cellulose-rich materials, such as wood, paper, or textiles. It is commonly found in indoor environments with high moisture levels, and its presence can be an indicator of water damage or poor indoor air quality.

The identification and study of Stachybotrys chartarum IBT 40293 are important in understanding the potential health risks associated with fungal contamination and developing strategies for prevention and remediation.
